intro: Tapura amazonica var. manausensis, commonly known as the Manaus tapura, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
